data: Business Analyst, Principal - Health Data Strategy - job post Blue Shield of California 900 reviews Oakland, CA 94607 $114,400 - $171,600 a year -  Full-time You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Salary $114,400 - $171,600 a year Encouraged to Apply Fair chance Job Type Full-time JOB DESCRIPTION Your Role The Health Transformation organization is committed to identifying, designing, implementing, evaluating, and launching innovations that transform health. Key to the goal of transforming health is creatively and effectively leveraging the power of data. The Business Analyst Principal, Health Data Strategy will be a key business product owner of the Integrated Health Record at Blue Shield and will lead health data strategy to drive improvements in care delivery and experience. In this role you will be responsible for developing the business strategy around the integrated health record. In collaboration with health data vendors, stakeholders, and technology partners, you will create a process to acquire necessary data, evaluate data and enable it to be used to improve patient care, and reduce healthcare costs. The position reports to the Director, Health Data Strategy, is based in California; open to telecommute within California with the ability to travel to our headquarters in Oakland and other locations as needed. Your Work In this role, you will: Support the development of the Integrated health record strategy, associated data roadmap and vendor relationships Conceptualize and develop prototypes for data strategy that meets business needs Describe and disseminate significance of data for business decision making and provide recommendations to senior leaders Lead design and interpretation of various data sources to meet health data strategy goals including, but not limited to, creation of integrated health record Support strategic planning around health data including identification of appropriate data sources, integration, and quality assessment Take hands on role on issues related to interoperability, data capabilities and data readiness Support identification and development of use cases for Integrated Health Record Serve as a partner to the Health Transformation Data & Evaluation team and Health Data Strategy team QUALIFICATIONS Your Knowledge and Experience Requires mastery level knowledge of job area typically obtained through advanced education combined with experience. May have deep knowledge of project management Requires a bachelors degree or equivalent experience. MS, MPH, MBA, MA Health Systems/Health Informatics/Health Information Technology focus is preferred Requires at least 10 years of prior relevant experience. Experience in Business Analytics within the healthcare industry is preferred Understanding of data and ability to provide strategic insights to drive business decisions Ability to leverage a deep understanding of business requirements to conceptualize business needs Proficiency and experience in health informatics is preferred Working familiarity with health information exchanges, interoperability, personal health records and meaningful use Knowledge of data architecture, clinical records integration, electronic medical records preferred Familiarity with potential and challenges associated with various forms of clinical and non-clinical datasets Experience with business strategy and leveraging data to drive strategic decisions Pay Range: The pay range for this role is: $ 114400.00 to $ 171600.00 for California. Note: Please note that this range represents the pay range for this and many other positions at Blue Shield that fall into this pay grade. Blue Shield salaries are based on a variety of factors, including the candidate's experience, location (California, Bay area, or outside California), and current employee salaries for similar roles.
